content:
• Wednesday, May 1, 2013
  • STX

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) +4.8% AH after guiding on its FQ3 call for FQ4 revenue of $3.3B-$3.45B,...

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) +4.8% AH after guiding on its FQ3 call for FQ4 revenue of $3.3B-$3.45B, in-line with a $3.35B consensus and easing PC-related concerns. Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) +1.6%. In prepared remarks, Seagate estimates the hard drive industry saw 136M shipments in FQ3, nearly even with the 135.4M estimated by WDC. Seagate pegs its share at 41%, down from FQ2's 43%; WDC claims its share rose 80 bps Q/Q to 44.4%. High-margin enterprise drive sales rose 3% Q/Q to 7.5M (boosted by Web/cloud storage); PC drives -7% to 36.6M, "non-compute" drives down slightly to 11.6M. Gross margin was flat Q/Q at 27.6%. (slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:45 PM

  • CZR

    More on Caesars Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR): Q1 result misses on both bottom and line...

    More on Caesars Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR): Q1 result misses on both bottom and line expectations as total sales decline by 6% Y/Y. Net losses narrowed however, as the the lower revenues were offset by a tax benefit and a decrease in depreciation expense. Las Vegas segment revenue fell 2.6%, weighed down by construction and renovation activities, with revenue from the Iowa and Missouri region -6.9%, Illinois and Indiana -4.6% and Louisiana and Mississippi -8.1%. Shares -1.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM

    Caesars Int'l (NASDAQ:CZR): Q1 EPS loss of $1.74 misses by $0.16. Revenue of $2.14B (-6% Y/Y) misses by $50M. (PR). Shares -1.6% AH.

  • GLUU

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Glu Mobile (GLUU - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $16.5M-$17.5M and...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Glu Mobile (GLUU - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $16.5M-$17.5M and EPS of -$0.06 to -$0.07, below a consensus of $20.3M and -$0.04. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $84M-$88.5M and EPS of -$0.12 to -$0.14, below a consensus of $88.8M and -$0.11. 2) GT Advanced (GTAT - earnings) expects 2013 revenue of $500M-$600M and EPS of $0.25-$0.45 vs. a consensus of $524.8M and $0.28. Backlog -32% Q/Q in Q1 to $851M. 3) Rovi (ROVI - earnings) expects FQ2 revenue of $630M-$660M and EPS of $1.95-$2.25 vs. a consensus of $646.1M and $2.07. GLUU -4.7% AH. GTAT -6.7%. ROVI nearly unchanged. (Glu PR) (GT Advanced PR) (Rovi PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • BRCD

    Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) -3.2% AH after preannouncing FQ2 (April quarter) revenue of $536M-$541M...

    Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) -3.2% AH after preannouncing FQ2 (April quarter) revenue of $536M-$541M and EPS of $0.15-$0.16; the latter is in-line with a $0.15 consensus, but the former is below a $565.4M consensus. Weak SAN revenue (-6% to -7% Y/Y) is responsible for the revenue shortfall; Brocade blames "softness in the overall storage market," which impacted OEM partner sales. IP networking sales (Ethernet switches) rose 14%-15% Y/Y, but they're still less than half of SAN revenue. Did Brocade's CEO and sales chief transitions play a role? The FQ2 report arrives on May 16. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM

    Yelp (NYSE:YELP): Q1 EPS of -$0.08 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $46.1M (+68% Y/Y) beats by $1.5M. Adjusted EBITDA of of $3.2M beats guidance of $1.25M-$1.5M. Expects Q2 revenue of $52.5M-$53.5M, above consensus of $50.6M. Expects 2013 revenue of $216M-$218M, above consensus of $211.8M. Expects Q2 adjusted EBITDA of $4.5M-$5M, 2013 adjusted EBITDA of $21M-$23M. Shares +8.4% AH. (PR)

  • LVS

    More on Las Vegas Sands' (NYSE:LVS) Q1: Casino revenue gained 15.5% Y/Y to $778.5M to help...

    More on Las Vegas Sands' (NYSE:LVS) Q1: Casino revenue gained 15.5% Y/Y to $778.5M to help offset slips in the company categories such as rooms, conventions, and food and beverage. Slot handle revenue was flat, but the casino operator saw its table game win percentage increase 70 bps to help boost its drop. Macau begins to pay off in earnest with RevPAR soaring past the same measure at Vegas and other domestic properties. LVS +1% AH. (PR)

    CBS (NYSE:CBS): Q1 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $4.04B beats by $0.03B. Shares +1%...

  • SHPG

    Viropharma (VPHM -7%) finishes lower after its Q1 earnings missed on the top line. Net sales...

    Viropharma (VPHM -7%) finishes lower after its Q1 earnings missed on the top line. Net sales declined Q/Q, which was driven by a decline in Vancocin revenues due to generic competition. Vancocin net sales during the three months were $4M compared to $66M in the year prior. The company also reaffirmed FY13 revenues towards the low end of estimates, expecting to earn between $440M - $465M, versus the Street consensus of $464M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • HCBK

    Hudson City Bancorp (HCBK -1.5%) slides post-earnings after slashing its quarterly dividend by...

    Hudson City Bancorp (HCBK -1.5%) slides post-earnings after slashing its quarterly dividend by 50% to $0.04/share amid a continuing interest margin squeeze. NIM fell to 1.78% from 1.97% in Q4, and 2.15% a year ago. The company provided no update on regulatory approval for its still-in-limbo merger with M&T Bank (NYSE:MTB).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMD

    What's going on with AMD (AMD +14.4%)? The chipmaker's shares have taken off on volume that's 5x...

    What's going on with AMD (AMD +14.4%)? The chipmaker's shares have taken off on volume that's 5x its daily average, even though no major news has hit the wires. Wells Fargo (Outperform) wrote this morning AMD has launched two new chips for its high-end FX desktop CPU line, and that its CPU pricing seems to be stabilizing, but it seems unlikely that's responsible for today's huge move. 16.9% of AMD's float was shorted as of April 15. Update: As SA commenters note, Intel buyout rumors appear to have played a role. Considering the antitrust issues, this rumor is even harder to swallow than the ones about Samsung and Qualcomm.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 13 Comments
  • JRCCQ

    James River Coal (JRCC +30.1%) pushed higher all session after posting a Q1 loss that...

    James River Coal (JRCC +30.1%) pushed higher all session after posting a Q1 loss that wasn’t as big as expected, but there's no apparent explanation for the stock's final-hour explosion on heavy volume. Some in the Twitter universe ruefully note Patriot Coal spiked just before declaring bankruptcy. Briefing.com reports JRCC debt is trading at distressed levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 8 Comments
  • SSKN

    Mela Sciences (MELA -10.6%) takes a hit today after its Q1 revenue misses by a huge margin...

    Mela Sciences (MELA -10.6%) takes a hit today after its Q1 revenue misses by a huge margin despite a nearly 12-fold increase over year-ago levels. Revenue for the three months ended March 31 totaled $144,100, up from $11,250 during the same quarter last year but still lagging the analyst consensus by more than 76%, as a sizeable chunk of the quarters revenue from Melafind sales were deferred.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 3 Comments
  • KODK

    Eastman Kodak (EKDKQ.PK -72.9%) has plummeted to a mere $0.10 on the pink sheets after...

    Eastman Kodak (EKDKQ.PK -72.9%) has plummeted to a mere $0.10 on the pink sheets after announcing a post-bankruptcy reorganization plan in which existing equity holders will see their shares cancelled. Second-lien noteholders will own 85% of the company, and unsecured creditors and retirees 15%. Kodak, which projects a $441M post-bankruptcy valuation, expects to exit Chapter 11 in Q3. (PR) (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 4 Comments
  • PCYC

    A number of biotechs are sharply lower amid rumors of a sizable Bio-fund going out of business...

    A number of biotechs are sharply lower amid rumors of a sizable Bio-fund going out of business and liquidating its positions. It's Ayer Capital Management according to sources, reports Adam Feuerstein. (PCYC -5.6%), (CLDX -4.9%), (NPSP -3.1%), (HALO -3.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 6 Comments
  • ANV

    Allied Nevada (ANV -8.4%) slumps to a 52-week low a day after announcing a review of plans to...

    Allied Nevada (ANV -8.4%) slumps to a 52-week low a day after announcing a review of plans to complete an expansion of its Hycroft Mill gold mine and a potential phased construction of an ore-processing plant. BMO cuts its price target to $10.50 from $18 due to the negative impact on NPV of lower metal prices, increasing cash costs and equity financing dilution.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • ACAS

    American Capital (ACAS -4.9%) bulls may be getting a buying opportunity post-earnings. A $47M...

    American Capital (ACAS -4.9%) bulls may be getting a buying opportunity post-earnings. A $47M sequential decline in revenue is largely the result of non-recurring factors, according to management (CC transcript). Of a $49M increase in non-accruals, CFO John Erickson reminds the company is often in a "very" junior position and weaker performance can force a loan into non-accrual status, but that doesn't mean the return disappears. (presentation slides).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • SU

    Suncor’s (SU -2.2%) 54% dividend hike not only topped expectations for a 30%-40% increase,...

    Suncor’s (SU -2.2%) 54% dividend hike not only topped expectations for a 30%-40% increase, it has the Street convinced more is coming. SU is the only major Canadian energy producer to generate free cash flow this year, which allows it to commit to competitive dividend increases, Canaccord notes; CIBC sees SU as a "free cash flow machine," producing $2.8B of FCF in 2012 with another $1B-$2B forecast for this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • RDN

    Radian (RDN -3.1%) recovers somewhat from a near 7% dive during the conference call as analysts...

    Radian (RDN -3.1%) recovers somewhat from a near 7% dive during the conference call as analysts tried to get their heads around a confusing compensation plan whose cost seems to be tied to more than just performance. KBW's Bose George asked if a flat stock price would cut the cost to zero, and CFO Bob Quint said not necessarily. Is there a way to hedge it, asked Dowling's Geoffrey Dunn. "That's an interesting question," replied CEO Sanford Ibrahim.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean's (RIG +1.8%) proposed $2.24/share dividend is "sustainable" for now but the offshore...

    Transocean's (RIG +1.8%) proposed $2.24/share dividend is "sustainable" for now but the offshore drilling contractor plans to raise the dividend rate in future years as earnings increase, CEO Steve Newman tells FT. But until then, he says the industry's moves into deeper water and more challenging conditions means RIG needs to retain the financial strength to invest in new drillships, which can cost $750M each.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 4 Comments
  • AMX

    As expected, Mexico's Congress has passed a telecom reform bill that removes foreign investment...

    As expected, Mexico's Congress has passed a telecom reform bill that removes foreign investment limits and creates an independent regulator that can force companies with 50%+ market share - America Movil (AMX -3.4%) and Grupo Televisa (TV -0.1%) to sell assets. However, automatic asset sales, once a concern, aren't part of the package, and a Congressional revision gives the companies a chance to appeal fines and asset sale rulings. AMX is giving back yesterday's gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • MXWL

    Maxwell (MXWL -6.7%) is giving back the Tuesday gains that came following the release of Q4/Q1...

    Maxwell (MXWL -6.7%) is giving back the Tuesday gains that came following the release of Q4/Q1 financial data, and then some. A likely factor: Maxwell's disclosure that it's "cooperating with investigations" from the DOJ and SEC related to its revenue restatements. This isn't Maxwell's first run-in with the agencies.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG +7.1%) spikes higher after announcing the Virginia district court handling its suit...

    Vringo (VRNG +7.1%) spikes higher after announcing the Virginia district court handling its suit against Google, AOL, IAC, Gannett, and Target denied a motion from the defendants to "Compel the Deposition" of Vringo witness Stephen Becker, and to increase the time to oppose Vringo's motion for post-judgment royalties. Moreover, the defendants have been ordered to respond to Vringo's motion in 10 days. (PR) (previous) (Vringo's motion)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 3 Comments
  • ARMH

    ARM's (ARMH +2%) chip royalty rate will rise to 1.5% next year from 1.3% last year, and could...

    ARM's (ARMH +2%) chip royalty rate will rise to 1.5% next year from 1.3% last year, and could approach 2% by 2020, says Canaccord's Matthew Ramsay in an upbeat note that's helping the CPU core giant make new all-time highs. Higher Cortex CPU core and Mali GPU core shipments are lifting ARM's chip royalties, as is the adoption of quad and (in Samsung's case) octa-core mobile processors. Ramsay adds ARM, which saw chip shipments rise 35% Y/Y in Q1, could have a 50% CPU share by 2020, up from a current 32% - if that happens, microcontrollers and other embedded chips will play a big role. Shares trade at a lofty 53x 2013E EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • OUTD

    Outdoor Channel Holdings (OUTD +7.4%) continues to trade well north of last night's $9.15/share...

    Outdoor Channel Holdings (OUTD +7.4%) continues to trade well north of last night's $9.15/share cash offer from InterMedia. What's next? The two SA Pro authors who originally spotted this opportunity believe (I, II) Kroenke isn't ready to sell at $9.15 and InterMedia has already indicated it's willing to pay more than that. The final bid, says Whopper Investments, could come soon and is likely to be closer to $10 than $9.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • IQNT

    Midday top 10 gainers: IQNT +60%. BCOV +31%. CNIT-OLD +28%. MNOV +21%. MSPD +19%. SONS +15%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: IQNT +60%. BCOV +31%. CNIT-OLD +28%. MNOV +21%. MSPD +19%. SONS +15%. TRLA +15%. RATE +15%. REGN +14%. SGI +14%.
    Midday top 10 losers: ACCL -21%. RBC -20%. ESBF -17%. LEDS -16%. KFRC -15%. AGN -14%. CRAY -13%. ASTX -13%. XXIA -13%. UTI -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • CHK

    The ink was barely dry on Chesapeake's (CHK -2.1%) better-than-expected earnings report before...

    The ink was barely dry on Chesapeake's (CHK -2.1%) better-than-expected earnings report before worries resurface about its liquidity position and slow progress on its asset-sale program. In its conference call, CHK said its 2013 funding gap stands at $3.5B, barely halfway through its $7B asset-sale target. Concerns are exacerbated by supposedly receiving low prices for the assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 2 Comments
  • GRMN

    In spite of beating estimates, Garmin (GRMN -3.5%) is seeing a post-Q1 drop: shares are now down...

    In spite of beating estimates, Garmin (GRMN -3.5%) is seeing a post-Q1 drop: shares are now down 16% YTD. No guidance was provided - as with prior years, Garmin will provide it following its Q2 report. Gross margin was 52%, up from Q4's 49% and Q1 2012's 51%. But op. margin fell to 15% as opex rose slightly Y/Y in spite of a 4% rev. drop. Automotive/mobile sales (45% of total) -10% Y/Y as smartphone continue taking a toll, but that's better than Q4's -25%. Outdoor -1% (-2% prior), Fitness +2% (+10% prior), Marine -10% (-9% prior), Aviation +10% (-2% prior). No buybacks took place. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • AUY

    Another day, another gold miner gets hammered: Yamana Gold's (AUY -7.7%) Q1 results disappoint...

    Another day, another gold miner gets hammered: Yamana Gold's (AUY -7.7%) Q1 results disappoint despite a pledge to cut costs by $100/oz. by midyear and $150/oz. by year-end. AUY will be tested not just by falling gold prices but also by copper prices, Cowen’s Adam Graf says, noting AUY's Q1 cash costs jumped 31% Y/Y partly on lower copper credits generated from lower copper sales volumes.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 3 Comments
  • BCOV

    Beaten-down Brightcove (BCOV +30.9%) is having a memorable day after beating Q1 estimates. The...

    Beaten-down Brightcove (BCOV +30.9%) is having a memorable day after beating Q1 estimates. The online video hosting/distribution platform is guiding for Q2 revenue of $25.7M-$26.2M and EPS of -$0.06 to -$0.07, mostly above a consensus of $25.3M and -$0.07. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $104M-$106M and EPS of -$0.15 to -$0.22 vs. a consensus of $103.8M and -$0.21. Brightcove mentioned on its earnings call 65 premium customers were added in Q1, and 111 volume customers were lost (due to the discontinuing of a $5/video offering). Total customers stood at 6,321 (1,690 premium) vs. 4,254 a year ago. Shares were crushed in Feb. following Brightcove's Q4 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • FISV

    More on Fiserv's (FISV -2.4%) Q1 miss: Adjusted internal revenue growth falls flat as a gain in...

    More on Fiserv's (FISV -2.4%) Q1 miss: Adjusted internal revenue growth falls flat as a gain in the payments segment was offset by a decline in financial segment revenue growth. Adjusted EPS rises 13% Y/Y while operating margins shrink 30 bps. The company reiterates its FY13 revenue guidance but cuts its EPS outlook to $5.84-6.03 (analysts see $5.97). "Am I right to [think] you're going to realize synergies [from the Open Solutions acquisition] sooner than anticipated?" Oppenheimer's Greg Greene asked on the call. "You are right in terms of timing," CEO Jeffery Yabuki responded. In an otherwise upbeat note, Greene downgrades the shares to Perform from Outperform citing valuation. (PR, transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • DVN

    When an energy company wants to excite investors, just talk about starting an MLP. Devon Energy...

    When an energy company wants to excite investors, just talk about starting an MLP. Devon Energy (DVN +2.4%) pops higher during its conference call after saying an evaluation of the possible creation of a midstream MLP should be completed by the end of the current quarter. DVN also says it will immediately repatriate ~$2B of its foreign cash with minimal additional tax.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 2 Comments
  • CLD

    Buy the dip in Cloud Peak Energy (CLD -8.1%), Goldman Sachs suggests, as improving coal...

    Buy the dip in Cloud Peak Energy (CLD -8.1%), Goldman Sachs suggests, as improving coal fundamentals provide a key medium-term driver. Goldman maintains its Buy rating and would add to positions, seeing spot PRB prices actually improving with physical inventories during the year. Brean Capital goes the other way, cutting shares to Hold from Buy following CLD's Q1 miss and weak guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • AGN

    Allergan (AGN -9.4%) dives as management - on today's earnings call - has less than great...

    Allergan (AGN -9.4%) dives as management - on today's earnings call - has less than great progress to report on a couple of drugs in development. Regeneron (REGN +12.4%) spikes higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • AA

    Alcoa (AA -1.8%) plans to review 460K metric tons of capacity over the next 15 months for...

    Alcoa (AA -1.8%) plans to review 460K metric tons of capacity over the next 15 months for potential curtailment, ~11% of global capacity, in a bid to compete in a market where aluminum prices have plunged more than 33% since peaking in 2011. Alcoa already has 13% of its smelting capacity idle; just weeks ago, it reported solid demand in its auto and aerospace end markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 2 Comments
  • COT

    More on Cott Corporation's (COT -10.4%) Q1: A generalized market decline in carbonated soft...

    More on Cott Corporation's (COT -10.4%) Q1: A generalized market decline in carbonated soft drinks exacerbated by soft volumes led to "unfavorable fixed cost absorption and adversely impacted gross margins," the company says.     Bankrate (NYSE:RATE) rises 12% premarket after earnings beat estimates. Revenue grew 16% sequentially marking the "first Q/Q growth since we began culling low performing lead sources a year ago," CEO Thomas Evans said. On the call, Goldman analyst Heath Terry (who downgraded the stock on April 23) noted that "if [you] look back at the last 3 years on average Q4 versus Q1, Q1's grown 16%" every year. "How much of what we're seeing" is seasonality, Terry asked. "Conversions were up, traffic was up, so we think its more than just the normal seasonality," CFO Edward DiMaria responded. The shares are now 52% above GS's target price. (transcript)
